item.title:
RT by @grievousangeluk: The court claims a right to abortion is not "deeply rooted in this Nation‚Äôs history and tradition."
Is that true? I searched 18th century newspapers because I wanted to learn how people really felt about abortion at America's founding.
Answer: they *loved* abortion. Thread! üßµ

item.title:

item.title:
RT by @grievousangeluk: Another reminder that the right's crusade against abortion has its roots in white supremacy.
Far-right extremists see the end of Roe as a stepping stone toward their broader goal of a white, Christian, patriarchal nation. Today, they are emboldened.
https://www.politico.com/magazine/story/2014/05/religious-right-real-origins-107133/

item.title:
RT by @grievousangeluk: I saw this secret on @postsecret, and here's the thing:
You know how artists say, "If my art only means something to one person, that would be enough"? It's okay if that one person is the artist.
item.dc:creator: @scalzi
item.description:
I saw this secret on @postsecret, and here's the thing:

You know how artists say, "If my art only means something to one person, that would be enough"? It's okay if that one person is the artist.

item.title:
RT by @grievousangeluk: Abortion is now illegal in Missouri.
No exceptions for rape or incest.
Right before I was elected, I met a pregnant 11 year old who has been raped by her uncle.
What about HER rights?
